Generation I.Red: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute .
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute .
Generation I.Yellow: Its cries are very noisy. This is because each of the 3 heads thinks about whatever it likes.
Generation I.Stadium: Each of the fruits is an independently-thinking head. It is said that if one drops off, it becomes an Exeggcute .

Generation II.Gold: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.
Generation II.Silver: If a head drops off, it emits a telepathic call in search of others to form an Exeggcute cluster.
Generation II.Crystal: Living in a good environment makes it grow lots of heads. A head that drops off becomes an Exeggcute .
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) If a head drops off, it emits a telepathic call in search of others to form an Exeggcute cluster. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute .
Generation III.Sapphire: Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute .
Generation III.Emerald: Originally from the tropics, Exeggutor 's heads grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall, they group to form an Exeggcute .
Generation III.FireRed: It is called “The Walking Tropical Rainforest.” Each of the nuts has a face and a will of its own.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It is said that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute .

Generation IV.Diamond: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute .
Generation IV.Pearl: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute .
Generation IV.Platinum: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute .
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: If a head drops off, it emits a telepathic call in search of others to form an Exeggcute cluster.

Generation V.Black: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
Generation V.White: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
Generation V.Black 2: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
Generation V.White 2: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

Generation VI.X: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.
Generation VI.Y: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute.

Generation VII.Sun: Alola is the best environment for this Pokémon. Local people take pride in its appearance, saying this is how Exeggutor ought to look.
Generation VII.Moon: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Exeggutor is the pride of the Alolan people. Its image is carved into historical buildings and murals.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It swings its long neck like a whip and smacks its opponents. This makes Exeggutor itself dizzy, too.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: The strong sunlight of the Alola region has awakened the power hidden within Exeggcute. This is the result.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: The strong sunlight of the Alola region has awakened the power hidden within Exeggcute. This is the result.

Generation VIII.Sword: Blazing sunlight has brought out the true form and powers of this Pokémon.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon's psychic powers aren't as strong as they once were. The head on this Exeggutor's tail scans surrounding areas with weak telepathy.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is called the Walking Jungle. If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It is called the Walking Jungle. If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It swings its long neck like a whip and smacks its head into opponents. This makes Exeggutor itself a little dizzy too.
Generation IX.Violet: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.
